flaw_data.description: Guide hand positioned underneath ball instead of on side
flaw_data.plain_language: Your guide hand is too far under the ball. Keep it on the side for proper support without interference.
flaw_data.coaching_tip: Position your guide hand on the side of the ball, not underneath. Think "passenger, not driver."
flaw_data.drill_suggestion: Tennis ball drill: Hold a tennis ball with your guide hand on the side while shooting with the other.

detailed_flaws.description: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shooting elbow is sticking out too far from your body. This reduces accuracy and consistency.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Wall shooting drill: Stand arm's length from a wall and practice your shooting motion without hitting the wall.

detailed_flaws.description: Guide hand positioned underneath ball instead of on side
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your guide hand is too far under the ball. Keep it on the side for proper support without interference.
detailed_flaws.coaching_tip: Position your guide hand on the side of the ball, not underneath. Think "passenger, not driver."
detailed_flaws.drill_suggestion: Tennis ball drill: Hold a tennis ball with your guide hand on the side while shooting with the other.

detailed_flaws.description: Advanced analysis detected jerky or rushed shooting motion lacking smooth rhythm
detailed_flaws.remedy_tip: Focus on smooth, rhythmic motion from start to finish. Practice shooting in slow motion to develop muscle memory.
detailed_flaws.exercise_tip: Practice the complete shooting motion without a ball, focusing on fluid movement.
detailed_flaws.plain_language: Your shot motion shows jerky movement (fluidity score: 26.2/100). Work on smoother, more rhythmic motion from start to finish.

feedback_points.discrepancy: Elbow Flare: Shooting elbow positioned too far from body

feedback_points.remedy_tips: Keep your shooting elbow directly under the ball. Imagine shooting through a narrow tunnel.
